title: Christina Kaufman
text:
Christina Kaufman (; born December 7, 1964) is an American former <a href="Association%20football">soccer</a> player who played as a <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a>, making two appearances for the <a href="United%20States%20women%27s%20national%20soccer%20team">United States women's national team</a>.
Career.
In college, Kaufman played soccer for the <a href="San%20Diego%20State%20Aztecs">San Diego State Aztecs</a>, beginning in the 1985 and 1986 seasons. However, at the time it was only a <a href="College%20club%20sports%20in%20the%20United%20States">club sport</a> at San Diego. In club soccer, she played for <a href="Ajax%20America%20Women">Southern California Ajax</a> of <a href="Manhattan%20Beach%2C%20California">Manhattan Beach, California</a> in the 1990s, including the 1993 season where the team won the Region IV amateur championship and the <a href="USASA%20National%20Women%27s%20Amateur">USASA National Women's Amateur</a>. In the regional final, Ajax won 3–1 over the Sacramento Storm to qualify for the national championship. At the championship in <a href="Indianapolis">Indianapolis</a>, Kaufman scored five of the team's eleven goals in the two-match tournament. Ajax beat the Florida Comets 7–2 in the final on July 18, 1993, with Kaufman subsequently named the tournament's <a href="most%20valuable%20player">most valuable player</a>. She also played for Cal South Soccer, including the 1995 season where the team won the Region IV title. In the final against Oregon, Kaufman scored twice in a 3–0 win.
Kaufman made her international debut for the <a href="United%20States%20women%27s%20national%20soccer%20team">United States</a> on August 4, 1993 in a <a href="Exhibition%20game">friendly</a> match against <a href="New%20Zealand%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">New Zealand</a>. She earned her second and final cap two days later in a friendly match against <a href="Trinidad%20and%20Tobago%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Trinidad and Tobago</a>, and scored one goal in the 9–0 win.
Personal life.
Kaufman attended <a href="California%20State%20University%2C%20Sacramento">California State University, Sacramento</a> from 1983 to 1985, before attending <a href="San%20Diego%20State%20University">San Diego State University</a> from 1985 to 1988. She serves as the <a href="garden">garden</a> coordinator at <a href="Sacramento%20Country%20Day%20School">Sacramento Country Day School</a>, and has two children.
